sense.name: an operational military unit
sense.examples: They are calling up an extra division of infantry. An entire division of their air force was wiped out on the ground. They have built up their navy to include a two divisions of battleships.

sense.name: the process of separating into parts
sense.commentary: DIVISION[+activity][+process][+separation] Note: is not a direct object of a verb, is after a PREPOSITION or in an SCOMP Note: often occurs as 'division OF x'
sense.examples: Let's come up with a fair division of labor on this project. The cancer is especially vulnerable to the drug during cell division The children quarreled over the division of the candy. They watched him carefully to ensure that the division of gold done properly.

sense.name: a taxonomic group of organisms, e.g. plants
sense.examples: Which division of the plant kingdom does algae belong in? Scholars don't all agree on his divisions of these species of organisms.

sense.name: an amount or portion of something
sense.commentary: DIVISION[+quantity][+amount] Note: occurs as a direct object of a verb
sense.examples: Each university will receive an equal division of the total funding. Labor feels it has always received a smaller division of the pie than management. Mary keeps a large division of her garden just for lettuce.

sense.name: an administrative department
sense.examples: There are a couple of job openings in our product division. He used to work in some division of the Department of Education.

sense.name: a mathematical operation
sense.examples: My brother taught me how to do division. Division by zero is something to be avoided. These story problems involve division and multiplication.

sense.name: a state of discord or strife
sense.commentary: DIVISION[+state][+discord] Note: often occurs with prep 'between' or 'among', implies a negative state of affairs
sense.examples: The divisions among the royal family may destroy the monarchy. The long-standing division between these peoples will make peace difficult. There was an unspoken division between them about how to raise their daughter.

sense.name: a ranked league, e.g., sports
sense.examples: At the volleyball tournament John will play in the top division. They won the championship of their division last year. As a chess player I'd probably only make the third or fourth division.

sense.name: a boundary or delimiter
sense.examples: The river forms a natural division between the two countries. The division between our properties is indicated only by an old post. The old party divisions along ideological lines are becoming blurred.
